articles.headline: Obama Seeks a Course of Pragmatism in the Middle East
articles.snippet: President Obama has adopted a policy of restraint in the Middle East crisis, recognizing a stark reality that U.S. security interests weigh as heavily as idealistic impulses.
articles.abstract: President Obama has adopted a policy of restraint in the Middle East crisis, recognizing a stark reality that U.S. security interests weigh as heavily as idealistic impulses.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In the Middle East crisis, as on other issues, there are two Barack Obamas: the transformative historical figure and the pragmatic American president. Three months after a Tunisian fruit vendor set himself aflame and ignited a political firestorm across the Arab world, the president is trumping the trailblazer.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Crisis Is Over, but Where’s the Fix?
articles.snippet: The economic recovery in most developed countries is stuttering at best, and governments are struggling with finances. It is time for remorse and second-guessing.
articles.abstract: The economic recovery in most developed countries is stuttering at best, and governments are struggling with finances. It is time for remorse and second-guessing.

articles.headline: Germany Sets Steep Price to Shore Up Euro Zone
articles.snippet: Leaders will debate proposals to shore up the weakest euro-zone states in return for more scrutiny over their spending, taxes and social policies.
articles.abstract: Leaders will debate proposals to shore up the weakest euro-zone states in return for more scrutiny over their spending, taxes and social policies.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN  Faced with financial turmoil that has resisted every emergency fix the European Union has adopted, European leaders are considering a radical step: giving up some of their independence to set domestic economic policies and cutting back many of the wage and welfare benefits that have defined the region’s politics for decades. In return, the European Union would provide funds to shore up the weakest member states, including Portugal, Greece and Spain.

articles.headline: The Burden of Pensions on States
articles.snippet: In Wisconsin, new pension cost estimates are expected to show that contribution levels are too meager and more money will be needed from public workers.
articles.abstract: In Wisconsin, new pension cost estimates are expected to show that contribution levels are too meager and more money will be needed from public workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: For public workers in Wisconsin, there’s more bad news.

articles.headline: U.S. Regulators and J.&J. Unit Reach a Deal on Plant Oversight
articles.snippet: Three plants operated by Johnson & Johnson’s McNeil Consumer Healthcare unit have had quality problems for over a year.
articles.abstract: Three plants operated by Johnson & Johnson’s McNeil Consumer Healthcare unit have had quality problems for over a year.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal regulators reached an agreement on Thursday with a unit of Johnson & Johnson that would impose greater federal oversight at three manufacturing plants responsible for recalls of children’s Tylenol and many other popular over-the-counter medicines.
articles.byline: By Reed Abelson and Natasha Singer

articles.headline: Start-Ups Are in a Rush to Bring the Chat Room to the Smartphone
articles.snippet: A wave of start-ups, including GroupMe, FastSociety and Beluga, are offering apps that allow multiple users to participate in smartphone text conversations.
articles.abstract: A wave of start-ups, including GroupMe, FastSociety and Beluga, are offering apps that allow multiple users to participate in smartphone text conversations.
articles.lead_paragraph: For all the clever things smartphones can do these days  like stream movies and play 3-D games  the latest mobile craze centers on revamping one of the earliest phone applications, the text message.

articles.headline: Powerful Quake and Tsunami Devastate Northern Japan
articles.snippet: Japan was filled with scenes of desperation a day after an 8.9-magnitude quake, as survivors called for help and rescuers looked for people buried in rubble.
articles.abstract: Japan was filled with scenes of desperation a day after an 8.9-magnitude quake, as survivors called for help and rescuers looked for people buried in rubble.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Rescuers struggled to reach survivors on Saturday morning as Japan reeled after an earthquake and a tsunami struck in deadly tandem. The 8.9-magnitude earthquake set off a devastating tsunami that sent walls of water washing over coastal cities in the north. Concerns mounted over possible radiation leaks from two nuclear plants near the earthquake zone.

articles.headline: In New Case, iPad Starts in an Instant
articles.snippet: Apple’s “smart cover” is like the refrigerator door: open it and the light goes on, revealing the inside.
articles.abstract: Apple’s “smart cover” is like the refrigerator door: open it and the light goes on, revealing the inside.
articles.lead_paragraph: In technology, fast is never fast enough.
